SCNLabel: System Code Number - the user equipment reference
TCCLabel: Specifies which TCC (traffic control computer) this equipment is defined on. This is usually worked out automatically from the subarea part of the SCN.
descriptionLabel: Description or location for this equipment
informationP1: A Function route plan can be setup with client-UX in isolation using the Function Route Editor (GRED command). This route plan contains the controllers with the desired stages and the relative offsets between the controller stages to time the progression through the route from the start. This can be used to activate a manual wave (MWAV) in the system (used for externally monitored VIP progression controlling each individual controller). To setup an Operator Function using the full Function route plan offset timings require further configuration for both remote and operator triggered Functions.
informationP2: The first step to setting up a fully automated Function in client is to create a global identifier for each instance. This is done here in this configuration form.
informationP3: After the Function has been created with its System Code Number (SCN), the next step is to setup a Remote Request (Function Route). This is to allow a single specified Function Route plan for the Function SCN to be remotely activated by an input direct from an OTU on street, or via operator control through the GWAV command using the Function SCN. If only the command triggered method is required then an unused outstation bit can be allocated for the remote request, which is never activated remotely.
saveIssueMsg: There are no changes to be saved.
deletePopupMsg: Are you sure you want to delete Green Wave
